body.p:
Frankfort Ky May 1st 1862
To his Excellency
B Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky
Dr Sir

I would respectfully state that while I was keeper of the Ky state Penetentiary The boy in question Jordan the then property of Dr R M Ewing of Scott County Ky was sent to the person where he remained till I left it I think some two or three years during which time his whole conduct was entirily unexeptionable

A short time before I left the prison a move was made for his pardon by petition & otherwise & upon the whole matter being fully laid before his Excellency Gov L W Powell he said to me that he would grant him a pardon but upon a full investigation of the law on the subject found that an act of the legislature was necessary in order to authorize him to do so I learn that the necessary law has been passed & I now most respectfully & urgently ask your favorable consideration of his case
this I do with a full knowledge of the fact that the citizens of scott county where he was convicted Generally desire the same & I have not heard of the first person objecting

Respectfully yours
N Craig
Late Keeper
Ky Penitentiary
